index.description: LeavesMC always follows the principle of balancing experience and performance, offering stable, secure, and rapidly evolving software so everyone can fully enjoy the fun of Minecraft.

1.description: Whether it's large redstone machines or various game mechanics, LeavesMC's software can handle it all.

index.title: Downloads
index.description: Select the software you want to download.

leaves.description: Leaves is a fork of Paper, aimed at repairing broken vanilla properties.

lumina.description: Lumina is a fork of Folia, aimed at following vanilla survival technical redstone features while introducing regionized multithreading.
lumina.disabled: Due to a lack of active developers, Lumina has been suspended.

all.legacy: Legacy builds are not supported. Proceed at your own risk!
all.experimental: Experimental builds are not ready for production servers. Proceed at your own risk!

index.description: Leaves is a Minecraft game server based on Paper, aimed at repairing broken vanilla properties.

1.label: Balancing experience and performance
1.description: Leaves has made numerous improvements and optimizations to handle large redstone machines and game features, achieving both great experience and performance.

2.label: An active and growing community
2.description: Leaves has an active and growing community of server administrators and developers. If you encounter any problems, you can come talk with us on Discord and get real-time support.

3.label: An expanded API
3.description: Leaves extends and improves the Bukkit, Spigot and Paper APIs so that you and your developers have more features and functionality at your fingertips.

1.title: Getting Started
1.description: To get started with Leaves, you will need to download and install the latest version of the server software. Once you're ready, take a look at our extensive documentation.

2.title: Together with a community of server owners
2.description: Whether you need help with your server settings, server lag, or need help with redstone machines, our knowledgeable staff and friendly community are always around to lend a hand.

index.title: What is Lumina?
index.description: Lumina is a fork of Folia, aimed at following vanilla survival technical redstone features while introducing regionized multithreading.

1.label: How's it different from Leaves?
1.description: Lumina has a lower priority and supports fewer features due to the introduction of regionized multithreading.

2.label: Is Lumina for me?
2.description: Lumina is better suited for large, player-dispersed servers with low plugin requirements, such as settlement-style survival servers.

3.label: Where can I learn more?
3.description: You can visit the GitHub repository for Lumina to read an overview of the project and some frequently asked questions.

1.title: Still under development
1.description: Please be patient, and we will soon be providing builds.

sponsor.title: Sponsor
sponsor.description: LeavesMC is an open community, and part of managing the community involves paying for services, servers, and infrastructure. We do what we can to keep our costs reasonable and sustainable, but some costs are unavoidable.

1.label: Sustainability
1.description: We strongly encourage donations from those who can afford to do so, and no one should feel bad if they cannot.

2.label: Future plans
2.description: We will upgrade our servers as our service demand grows.

3.label: Giving back
3.description: If we receive more donations than our monthly expenses, we may consider distributing the funds to contributors in a fair and transparent way.

team.title: Meet our team
team.description: Meet the members behind LeavesMC, a group of uncompromising Minecraft enthusiasts.

core-team.title: Core Team
core-team.description: Core Team members are responsible for the direction of the project, and for making the big decisions. Whether they focus on the code or the community, they're essential to making everything run and have final say in just about anything.

leaves-developers.title: Leaves Developers
leaves-developers.description: Leaves Developers help with writing code, reviewing PRs, and keeping the project lively. By contributing new features and helping to polish off old code, they make Leaves run.

web-developers.title: Web Developers
web-developers.description: Web Developers make LeavesMC onto the information superhighway. Through their efforts, you can touch the software of LeavesMC more conveniently.

contributors.title: Contributors
contributors.description: Contributors are those who have made important contributions to our codebase, helping our organization grow. From adding new quality-of-life features to submitting a fix for a nasty bug, our contributors help us provide the best software possible.

community.title: Join Our Community
community.description: Weâ€™re excited to have you as part of the LeavesMC community! Please read our community guidelines before getting involved.

discord.description: Discord is a popular platform for gamers to communicate. We have a community server on Discord that anyone can join.

qq-group.title: QQ Group
qq-group.description: You can join our QQ group and chat with other admins, developers, and project staff. However, this group is maintained by the community and is not officially affiliated with LeavesMC.

giscus.description: You can leave comments or share tips via GitHub here.

contribute.title: You can contribute
contribute.description: Our projects are built on community contributions and wouldn't be possible without them. There are many ways to contribute, even without programming knowledge.

donate.title: ...Financially
donate.description: LeavesMC uses Patreon and Afdian to manage recurring expenses, most of which are related to infrastructure.

code.title: ...Code
code.description: Much of the code in our projects is written by community members, and we welcome your contributions!

support.title: ...Support
support.description: A lot of users result in a lot of questions. Everyone is welcome to answer questions or provide support, whether on our Discord server or in our QQ group.

documentation.title: ...Documentation
documentation.description: Constantly evolving software requires up-to-date documentation. Whether you want to report missing information or add guides, we always appreciate your help.

description.line1: Looking for more older builds or changelogs?
description.line2: Even older builds are available in our <0><0>build explorer</0></0>.

500.title: Error
500.description: We are very sorry for the inconvenience. If you'd like, please report the bug to help us fix it.

404.title: Not Found
404.description: We could not find the page you requested. If you think this is an error, please report the bug.
